results.title: Ears: their structure and care
results.brief_description: Illustrates the structure of the outer, middle and inner ear and describes the role of each in the hearing process. Discusses care of the ear and treatment of some common ailments relating to the ear. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Early days yet: a profile of the poet Allen Curnow
results.creator_credit: Shirley Horrocks and Point of View Productions
results.brief_description: This is a beautifully presented documentary about the life and memories of the highly acclaimed New Zealand poet, critic and anthropologist, Allen Curnow. At the age of almost 90, Allen Curnow still wrote poetry using “a ball-point, quantities of A4 paper, and a typewriter”. Charming, gentle and retiring, family man and serious poet, Allen Curnow has won many awards in the world of literature including seven New Zealand Book Awards and the first person outside of Britain to receive the Queen’s Gold Medal for Poetry. The program features Curnow reading several of his poems accompanied by evocative and emotive images to illustrate his writings which often reflect memories of people, places or events from his past. With his quiet sense of humor and reminiscing, and through interviews with his wife Jenny, and fellow poets including Bill Manhire, C.K. Stead, Ian Wedde, Leigh Davis and Elizabeth Smither, Allen Curnow allows us a glimpse into both his personal and his creative life. The documentary takes its title from his latest publication “Early days yet: new and collected poems 1941-1997”. Sadly Allen Curnow passed away on 23 September 2001, three months after completion of this film. Contains archival footage and some scenes in b&w.

results.title: Early Amateur Sound Film (1936–37)
results.brief_description: Amateur filmmaker Archie Stewart used an RCA Sound Camera to document family life from 1935. A member of the Amateur Cinema League, in 1937 he published one of the first articles on amateur sound, ‘A Talkie Movie Maker Speaks’, in the league’s magazine.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.title: Early abortion
results.brief_description: Uses scenes from a question-and-answer session and from an abortion procedure in order to explain a typical atravmatic abortion procedure. Narrated by Adrienne Barbeau and animation by Robert Greenberg

results.title: Dynasties
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Tim Clark and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Using rare archival footage, photographs and interviews, we are privy to family life and relationships of seven of Australia’s most powerful families. Nineteenth and twentieth century Australian history has been formed by some of the influence of these families - pastoralists, philanthropists, politicians and journalists - and some of their influence on society continues today. Families are: Murdoch, Downer, Wright, Myer, Durack, De Bortolis, and Macarthur. Two-disc set containing seven episodes from Series One of this fascinating ABC TV Documentary series. Narrated by William Zappa.

results.title: Dustbins in the sky
results.creator_credit: Mike Lockey, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Made for the television program “Perspective”, this documentary examined the growth of technology in the collection, transmission and dissemination of news, from early cinema newsreels to today’s satellite coverage.

results.title: Dust to dust
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a small town in northern NSW and the effects of asbestos mining there. The people estimate that three-quarters of the workers have died or are sick from exposure to asbestos. In presenting their story the film raises issues regarding occupational health in general.

results.title: Durer and the renaissance
results.brief_description: Part of the Art History series, describes the life and work of Albrecht Durer, German painter and engraver, and his part in connecting the artistic development in Italy with that of northern Europe.

results.title: Duplex
results.creator_credit: Michaela French, David Price and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Two elderly neighbours Elsie (Esme Melville) and Dora (Margaret Ricketts) are isolated by the limitations that their old age brings. Both are lonely but fail to strike up a friendship as personal obstacles like pride get in the way. Slowly, slowly, Elsie’s determination breaks Dora’s stubborn resistance and the two begin anew as friends. Written, directed and edited by Michaela French.
